name: Sarah Khan
title: Associate Professor, Pediatrics
overview: Dr. Sarah Khan is an Infectious Disease Specialist, Associate Professor and Head of the Division of Infectious Disease in the Department of Pediatrics at McMaster University. She is the Associate Medical Director for Infection, Prevention and Control with Hamilton Health Sciences and lead Infection Control Physician for all COVID-19 related matters at McMaster Children’s Hospital. She represents community needs with a voice at Hamilton Public Health, Ontario Health West and provincial committees to develop COVID-19 guidelines. Dr. Khan is a founding member of an Anti-Racism Coalition (ARC) which advocates for anti-racist and anti-oppressive systems and actions across her organization and within her community. She advocates for patients, families, healthcare providers and vulnerable populations and is a role-model in healthcare, public health, education and social justice.
